alert.note: Alert for Placer; Sacramento; Solano; Sutter (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 5:24PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Placer. In northern California, Sacramento, Solano, Sutter and Yolo. * WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sacramento, Davis, Woodland, Carmichael, West Sacramento, Dixon, Karnak, Knights Landing, Verona, Arco Arena, Rio Linda, Elverta, Pleasant Grove, Madison, North Highlands, Foothill Farms, Capay, Yolo, Esparto and El Macero. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
